dict.string: Repeatedly steps through the list comparing and swapping adjacent items if need be.
Partitions an array into a number of buckets. Can recursively apply bucket sort or use a different sort on the buckets.
Takes the least significant digits of the value to be sorted, then sorts the list of elements based on the digit.
First, the sort constructs a heap of the data. Then, the largest element is removed from the heap and inserted into a sorted array.
Recursively divides the data set and sorts the sub-arrays before merging them back in one at a time.
Iterates through the data set one-by-one and checks against previous entries.
Combines quick sort and heap sort.
Also known as partition-exchange sort. Continually creates pivots and sorts either halves.
Similar to insertion sort, but comparable elements are separated by a gap sequence.
